result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
(1) The DCA shall expire on August 22, 2028. However, should Mr. Meyer be in full compliance with the terms and conditions of this DCA, then he shall be eligible to earn early discharge from the DCA after a period of four (4) years - on or after August 22, 2026. If Mr. Meyer is in full compliance with the terms and conditions of this DCA and should he elect to do so, then Mr. Meyer shall request early discharge from the DCA by submitting a request in writing to the Court at the appropriate time. A copy of the request for early discharge from the DCA shall also be forwarded to the Sheboygan County District Attorney's Office.
(2) During the term of the DCA, the Defendant shall commit no violation of criminal law to the level of probable cause. "Probable cause" shall be that level of proof needed to sustain the sufficiency of the criminal complaint if a misdemeanor, or that level of proof needed to sustain a bindover for trial if a felony. Upon request, either party is entitled to an evidentiary hearing to determine if such proofs meet such probable cause standard.
(3) The Bail/Bond established in the case as of May 27,2022 shall remain in effect during the life of the Agreement, with the exception of the bond condition that requires Mr. Meyer to "[c]omply with Day Reporting requirements" including "GPS monitoring." In other words, upon entry into this DCA and during the period of this DCA, the State and Defense agree that Mr. Meyer shall not be subject to Day Reporting Requirements or GPS monitoring.
(4) If the DCA is not revoked during its term, the charges shall be dismissed with prejudice.
(5) No revocation may take place without a hearing before the Court with notice served upon all parties.
(6) The Defendant specifically waives his right to a speedy trial, disposition or any applicable statute of limitations to the charge covered by this DCA.

(7) In the event that the expiration date of this DCA has passed, nothing in this DCA or
the laws of the State of Wisconsin shall prevent the State from seeking revocation of
this DCA if the State has filed a motion to revoke this DCA prior to the expiration date.
(8) The Defendant agrees that he shall maintain his current address with the Sheboygan
County Clerk of Courts. Any change of address shall be updated with the Sheboygan
County Clerk of Courts within 72 hours of the change. The Defendant further agrees
that any court notice mailed to the most recent address he has on file with the
Sheboygan County Clerk of Courts is notice for any further court hearings on this case.
 (9) No contact directly or indirectly with the Victim, the Victim's family, the Victim's
residence, the Victim's family residence, or the Victim's workplace. However, Mr.
Meyer shall be allowed to drive past the Victim's family residence in order to get to his
rental land and/or former brother-in-law's house and/or for any other legitimate
purpose.
(10) Mr. Meyer shall not possess firearms within his home. However, Mr. Meyer shall be
allowed to possess firearms for the sole purposes of deer hunting, and only during the
State of Wisconsin's approved Deer Hunting Season, so long as he does not store
firearms within his home.

(11) The Defendant will obtain a domestic abuse assessment and follow-through with any
additional counseling, if the counselor or assessor or therapist deems that additional
counseling is necessary. If the assessor / counselor / therapist believes that
counseling is no longer necessary during the life of this DCA, then the Defendant shall
provide a letter from the assessor / counselor / therapist indicating as such and the
Defendant will be relieved of any further counseling at that time. The Defendant is not
required to continue with the same counselor/therapist over the life of this DCA, and
the Defendant may change counselor(s)/therapist(s) during this DCA, so long as he
continues to engage in counseling with a counselor/therapist unless and until a
counselor/therapist indicates in a letter that the Defendant no longer requires
counseling. Proof of continued counseling shall be provided to the Sheboygan County
District Attorney's Office at least two (2) weeks prior to the expiration date of this
DCA, unless the Defendant provides a letter from the counselor/therapist during the
life of this DCA wherein the counselor/therapist indicates that further counseling is no
longer necessary.

State - no prior record in Wisconsin. 
Court reviews maximum penalties. 
NC plea entered on Count 1 & 2.

Court advises deft of firearms prohibition & ineligible voting notice and acknowledgment if convicted.
Court accepts NC plea but holds open adjudication of Guilt. 
The signature bond will remain in place with the exception of the Day Reporting/GPS monitoring.
Court approves entire DCA to expire 8/22/2028. Deft may petition to request early discharge after 4 years if he is in full compliance.
Attorney Meyer to submit an Order. Deft signs new bond to remove GPS/Day reporting condition.
